did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.repository: Archives & Special Collections at the Thomas J. Dodd Research Center.
did.abstract: Rosekrans Hoffman was born 7 January 1926, in Denton, Nebraska. A painter and illustrator, Hoffman's work has been exhibited at Whitney Museum and Brooklyn Museum.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Rosekrans Hoffman was born 7 January 1926, in Denton, Nebraska, the daughter of James Charles (a contractor) and Pearl (Hocking) Rosekrans. She was educated at University of Nebraska (B.F.A., 1949). A painter and illustrator, Hoffman's work has been exhibited at Whitney Museum and Brooklyn Museum.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of 12 pieces of correspondence and 41 pieces of original artwork pertaining to Jane Yolen's Mother Goose Songbook (1992) [Dodd CLC C619].

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Archives & Special Collections has a substantial collection of children's literature and associated artwork. For detailed information on these collections please contact the curator or ask at the reference desk.

Greg Williams, The Case of the Missing Hat, Random House, 1982.

Clayton Bess, The Truth About the Moon, Houghton, 1983.
Lee Bennett Hopkins, How to Make an Elephant Float, Albert Whitman, 1983.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The materials were donated in 1994 by Ms. Hoffman.
